column2: Choose a patron deity
Although the people of Faerûn honour many gods, you may choose to devote yourself to one of them in particular.
Maybe I should choose a deity whose nature and special areas of concern are fitting to my position and governance.
One of the gods of rulership and domination.
One of the gods of the natural world of Toril.
One of the gods of violence and combat.
Maybe I should choose a deity who sponsors an activity which is close to my heart.
One of the gods of magic and sorcery.
One of the gods of knowledge and invention.
One of the gods of society and its activities.
A god with a different sort of portfolio...
Maybe I should choose a deity who will guide me through the unexpected and difficult parts of life.
One of the gods of darkness and concealment.
One of the gods of death and the dead.
A god with a different sort of portfolio...
Choosing a god of rulership will show that I am meant to be in charge.
Lord Bane, god of tyranny, fear and hatred.
Hoar, god of retribution and poetic justice.
Loviatar, goddess of pain and torture.
There are others...
A lesser-known god of rulership might reflect my ambitions better.
Siamorphe, goddess of nobles and royalty.
Tiamat, goddess of chromatic dragons and greed.
Gargauth, the exiled archdevil.
There are others...
A lesser-known god of rulership might reflect my ambitions better.
Iyacthu Xvim the Baneson, god of tyranny and hatred.
Amaunator, god of law and bureaucracy.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Choosing a god of nature will show my concern for the lands I govern.
Kossuth, primordial of fire.
Silvanus, god of the wilderness.
Umberlee, goddess of the wrathful sea.
There are others...
Maybe a more specialised nature deity would suit me.
Akadi, primordial of air.
Grumbar, primordial of earth.
Istishia, primordial of water.
There are others...
Maybe a more specialised nature deity would suit me.
Talona, goddess of disease and epidemics.
Geb, god of mines and miners.
Sebek, god of crocodiles and rivers.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Choosing a god of conflict will show the strength with which I mean to rule.
Tempus, Lord of Battles, chief god of war.
Red Knight, mistress of strategy.
Garagos, god of slaughter.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Dedicating myself to a god of magic will show my respect for the True Art.
[Root.MystraLoc], personification of the Weave, goddess of all magic.
Azuth, god of wizards and spellcraft.
Leira, goddess of illusion and mystery.
There are others...
Maybe another god of magic would suit me better.
Savras the All-Seeing, god of divination.
Velsharoon, the god of necromancy.
[Root.ThothLoc], the god of scribes and secrets.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Choosing a god of knowledge or the secular arts will show my commitment to learning.
[Root.OghmaLoc] the Binder, god of knowledge.
[Root.GondLoc] Wonderbringer, master of invention.
Ilsensine, god of mental domination and psionics.
There are others...
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
A different deity of knowledge might be more suitable.
Maanzecorian, god of memory and aptitude.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Choosing a god of society's various aspects will show how civilized I am..
Shaundakul the Rider of the Winds, god of the winds, travellers and exploration.
Sune Firehair, goddess of beauty and passion.
Waukeen, goddess of commerce and prosperity.
There are others...
A different deity of society might be more suitable.
Beshaba, goddess of bad luck.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Worshipping a god of darkness and concealment will show my subjects that they should rely on me for protection in this harsh world.
Mask, god of thieves and shadows.
Shar Nightsinger, goddess of secrets and forgetting.
Ghaundaur, god of rebels and oozes.
There are others...
A different deity of darkness might be more suitable.
Ibrandul, Lord of the Dry Depths, god of caverns and stealth.
Moander, god of rot and decay.
[Root.SetLoc], god of night and betrayal.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
Worshipping a god of death will represent my seriousness and concern for the future.
Kelemvor, Lord of the Dead, judge of the afterlife.
Jergal, the Scribe of Death, recorder of deeds.
Bhaal, god of death and murder.
There are others...
A different deity of death might be more suitable.
Myrkul the Reaper, god of decay and the dead.
Perhaps a different kind of deity after all...
